thread.title: Tourism Ireland invites LGBT couples around the world to say ‘I do’ in IrelandTravelandtourworld.com

author: travelandtourworld.com
title: Tourism Ireland invites LGBT couples around the world to say ‘I do’ in IrelandTravelandtourworld.com
text:
Tourism Ireland invites LGBT couples around the world to say ‘I do’ in Ireland Published on : Thursday, October 8, 2015
Tourism Ireland has launched a new online film, ‘The Outing 2015’, specially created to target LGBT couples around the world – inviting them to come and celebrate their weddings and honeymoons in Ireland.
The video was filmed last weekend at The Outing, the world’s first-ever LGBT matchmaking festival and an offshoot of the Lisdoonvarna Matchmaking Festival, which saw thousands of people descend on the north Clare town. It also features footage of the spectacular scenery in this part of Ireland, including the Cliffs of Moher.
Following the historic ‘yes’ vote in last May’s marriage referendum, Tourism Ireland rolled out a special LGBT campaign, which featured a video showcasing our spectacular scenery and The Outing. Tourism Ireland’s latest film, unveiled today, will be promoted on a specially-created section on the organisation’s website, Ireland.com. Tourism Ireland will also share the film on social media – with its Facebook fans (3+ million fans worldwide) and Twitter followers (300,000+), and on its YouTube channel.
Niall Gibbons, CEO of Tourism Ireland, said: “Research unveiled at World Travel Market last year showed the annual spend on travel by LGBT people exceeded USD$200 billion for the first time in 2014. Ireland’s ‘yes’ vote in May also delivered a strong message of tolerance, respect and open-mindedness, positioning Ireland as a welcoming destination for LGBT travellers. We are delighted to unveil our latest online film, highlighting The Outing and promoting Ireland to LGBT couples around the world, encouraging them to consider Ireland for their wedding or honeymoon.”
Source:- Tourism Ireland
